ygData.subject: Re: Stats for a char
ygData.msgSnippet: I really wouldn t worry to much about stats, location of starting point. Sure you may get a pretty lost at first, but you will find your way around eventually
ygData.messageBody:
I really wouldn't worry to much about stats,
location of starting point. Sure you may get a pretty lost
at first, but you will find your way around
eventually and it is always a good idea to have as maybe
places known to you. As for stats theres lots of stat
buffing stuff out there, as well as lots of buffing
spells. Faction however is something I would take in
consideration, depending however if you like being the "outlaw
type" hehe. I think the most important thing you should
look for is unique chararistics in a player. A warrior
who can safe fall(Vah Shir), or warrior who can
hide/forage for food(wood elf), which could come in handy I'm
sure, ah HG!!! /hide... =) A shammy, necro who has the
ability to regen as well as xtra Ac(Iksar) Unfortunatly I
don't speak from experiance, these are just ideas of
mine. I myself started with the typical Barb shammy
good character I think, but I wish I would have chosen
something a little "different"<br><br>Just my opionon....
=)
